intro: Orthodon japonicus var. hadae, commonly known as the Japanese orthodon, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in shaded forest understories.
